greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f. satisfies: A(x) = 1 + x/A(-x)^3.
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
formula: G.f. satisfies: A(x) = G(x/A(x)^3) where G(x) = A(x*G(x)^3) is the g.f. of A213282.
G.f. satisfies: A(x) = ( x/Series_Reversion( x*F(x/(1-x)^3)^3 ) )^(1/3) where F(x) = 1 + x*F(x)^3 is the g.f. of A001764.
example: The g.f. G(x) of A213282 begins:
where G(x) = A(x*G(x)^3) and G(x/A(x)^3) = A(x);
also, G(x) = F(x/(1-x)^3) where F(x) = 1 + x*F(x)^3 is g.f. of A001764:
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 08 2012
